page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area we surveyed is 84% sea.The sea is polluted and there are dangerous currents.To the east of the area there are cliffs.The beach is mostly bedrock but there are patches of pebbles and sand particularly in St Mary's Well Bay which is a tourist attraction.On Sully Island there are traces of an iron age fort.There are fast running tides especially over the causeway. Facing the Island is the Captain's Wife pub which is popular for young and old.Nearby is one of Wales' fine restaurants and Hotel,The Sully House, set in a secluded coastal position. To the east is the Glamorgan Nature Reserve which, due to the large variety of plants growing there is deesignated a Site of Special Scientific Interest.
